author: alexdma
msg: * First primitive support for owl:versionIRI and ownership (STANBOL-524) :
** scopes and sessions now try to claim ownership of unversioned ontologies by setting their ID as the versionIRI (TODO manage release/destruction of owned resources when scope/session goes down)
** all IRI->storage-key mappings now use (possibly versioned) OWLOntologyID objects instead of IRI. This is also serialized in the reserved Clerezza graph (for STANBOL-518)
* Registry support re-introduced for ontology lookups on main OntoNet REST endpoint when requesting a Clerezza-only supported format (JSON-LD, RDF/JSON, N3 etc.) (STANBOL-497)
* Several new additions to the default ontology network registry incl. SIOC, Provenance, SKOS and DC (STANBOL-410)

author: joern
msg: OPENNLP-476 Added OSGi bundle and the application for the rest servlet

author: ate
msg: RAVE-517: Create new rave-jcr war module providing a JCR/Jackrabbit service for Rave
- a rave-jcr-service jar module providing the wiring and access to a shared/cross-context javax.jcr.Repository instance
- a rave-jcr war module which just bundles Jackrabbit and the above rave-jcr-service
- a rave-demo-portal to provide and showcase the content services and integration features
- the maven groupId for these, and the parent rave-content-services, have been set to org.apache.rave.sandbox.jcr to provide proper isolation

- the barest minimal usage of the rave-jcr now can be tested by running the rave-demo-portal (mvn cargo:start) and invoke: http://localhost:8080/portal/jcr/jcr.repository.vendor (output: Apache Software Foundation)
this is only a temporary usage of course!

author: sergeyb
msg: Moving security-related bundles from cxf-jaxrs to separate features
